intro: Tragacantha gilva, commonly known as the Persian gum tree, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and woody pods. The plant is known for producing a valuable gum, tragacanth, which has been used historically in medicine and as a binding agent. Tragacantha gilva typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to poor soil conditions through its deep root system. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insect species.
